choke.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to be unable to breathe properly because something is in your throat or there is not enough air
choke.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Six people choked to death on the fumes.
He choked on a piece of bread.
choke.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly
choke.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
choke.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to prevent someone from breathing by putting your hands around their throat and pressing on it
choke.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: His hands were round her throat, choking her.
choke.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to be unable to talk clearly because you are feeling a strong emotion
choke.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: I was too choked with emotion to speak.
Her voice was choked with rage.
choke.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to say something with difficulty because you are very upset or angry
choke.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to fill a place so that things cannot move through it
choke.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The gutters were choked up with leaves.
choke.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to fail at doing something, especially a sport, because there is a lot of pressure on you
choke.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: People said I choked, but I just had a bad day on the golf course.
choke.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: if one plant chokes another, it kills it by growing all around it and taking away its light and room to grow
choke.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: Weeds can quickly choke delicate garden plants.
choke.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a piece of equipment in a vehicle that controls the amount of air going into the engine, and that is used to help the engine start
choke.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: the sound that someone makes when they cannot breathe properly because something is in their throat or there is not enough air
choke.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: She gave a little choke of laughter.
